newsitem.title: FRANCE: Castorama shares hit over foreign limits.
newsitem.headline: Castorama shares hit over foreign limits.

text.p: Castorama shares dropped sharply on the Paris stock exchange on Wednesday after a meeting with the Sfaf financial analysts association where the home improvements group said it lacked the foreign growth needed to make up for regulatory limits on expansion in France, analysts said.
The share was down 5.05 percent at 903 francs at 1357 GMT while the stock market trend was positive.
"There was no good news. We were expecting to hear something to the effect that regulatory limits in France were being compensated for abroad," said one analyst.
Another analyst said foreign business was only expected to make up seven to eight percent of total sales this year.
